oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tuha's sad song
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Egypt--Rural conditions; Egypt -- Social life and customs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: B&W, 12 min. Arabic sound track, English subtitles. Made by the Egyptian filmmaker, Atiyat el-Abnoudi, ca. 1970, this one shows street entertainers (jugglers, acrobats, puppeteers, dancers). The sound track includes a poem by the Egyptian poet Abderrahman el-Abnoudi. The fIlm not only shows the entertainment, but also stresses that this is a way of making a liVing, the training of children as entertainers, etc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Ethnographic and Anthropological Films - Egypt and Beyond
